```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo=FALSE)
library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
```

The educational and cognitive development are central aspects of a child's wellbeing. Children begin learning from birth and continue to expand their skills, knowledge, and capabilities as they progress through early childhood education, into the school system and beyond. Peer relations, relations with teachers and school administration, and family involvement all influence the educational experience of children playing an important role in their wellbeing in childhood and adulthood as individuals enter the labour force. Therefore, measuring aspects of the educational experience of children is important to determining their overall wellbeing.
